ThingDef.label: basic tonal core
ThingDef.description: The simplest possible tonal core, this is a tiny psychodynamic harmonic matrix unit housing a dull presences. Since this is only a basic-tier subcore, it can only drive the simplest of automatons.\n\nLike all constructs subcores, it contains a harmonic presence, albeit a very faint one.

ThingDef.label: standard tonal core
ThingDef.description: A standard-tier tonal core, this is a psychodynamic harmonic matrix supporting designed to house and sustain an active resonant subpersona. This particular core is stable and potent enough to drive a standard-tier automaton. \n\Constructs are more than brass and pistons, and this core is far more than a mechanical processor. Its thinking tonal echo grants it adaptability far beyond traditional machines. However, such cores cannot be fabricated by conventional means â€” they must be tuned and imprinted through analog tonal transference from an existing harmonic mind.

ThingDef.label: advanced tonal core
ThingDef.description:
An advanced-tier tonal core, this psychodynamic harmonic matrix supports an sophisticated and resonant subpersona. This particular core is of the strongest tier, can can power complex ultra-heavy automatons.
\The subpersona inside this core approaches a mortal mind in its complexity, though it is of a very different nature. Like any such mind, it has a noticeable psychic presence.

This subcore could only have been produced by full tonal transference from a living mind, destroying them utterly in the process
